byline.contributor: Mia Li and Vanessa Piao contributed research.

abstract: Middle-class families in China are reining in spending amid economic slowdown, threatening Communist Party's plan to shift reliance on trade and investment to more self-sustaining growth based on domestic consumption; many have turned to social media for advice, since state news media have reported little on stock market crash and slowing economy.
lead_paragraph: Middle-class Chinese are reining in spending amid the economic slowdown, damaging the ruling party’s hopes to push consumer spending as a new engine of growth.

headline.main: Consumer Anxiety in China Undermines Government’s Economic Plans
headline.print_headline: Fearing Slump, Rattled Chinese Long for Advice

snippet: Middle-class Chinese are reining in spending amid the economic slowdown, damaging the ruling party’s hopes to push consumer spending as a new engine of growth.
